intro: Pilogyne tenuispica, commonly known as the slender-spined pilogyne, is a unique member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces tiny, spiky fruits that contain minute seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
